title: Youth unemployment rate in Italy 2018 , by region
summary: This bar chart has 20 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Unemployment rate in each Month on the y axis.
The Unemployment rate is appeared to be the highest at Month Sicily and lowest at Month Trentino-South Tyrol.
There is a difference of 41.7 between the maximum Month Sicily and minimum Month Trentino-South Tyrol.
min_summary: This bar chart has 20 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Unemployment rate in each Month on the y axis.
The Unemployment rate is appeared to be the highest at Month Sicily and lowest at Month Trentino-South Tyrol.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 20 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Unemployment rate in each Month on the y axis.
The Unemployment rate is appeared to be the highest at Month Sicily and lowest at Month Trentino-South Tyrol.
There is a difference of 41.7 between the maximum Month Sicily and minimum Month Trentino-South Tyrol.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Month in the x axis and Unemployment rate in the y axis.
The Unemployment rate is appeared to be the highest at Month Sicily and lowest at Month Trentino-South Tyrol.
The second highest Unemployment rate is appeared to be the Month Campania.
The highest Month Sicily has 41.7 more Unemployment rate than the lowest Month Trentino-South Tyrol.
Unemployment rate at Month Sicily is 53.6 , second place is Campania at 53.6, and thirdly is Calabria at 52.7.
Over the past 20 Months, the Unemployment rate has declined.
Month Sicily, and Campania have the same Unemployment rate.
The Month Trentino-South Tyrol has 1.67 times less Unemployment rate than average.
Summing up the values of all Months, we get total 641.7.
